title: Add OpenSearch resources to the bundled example
description: Guidance & samples on how to make a Solr instance OpenSearch-compliant feels like it would add value to the user community.

comments.author: Rich Cariens
comments.content: First cut at what sample OpenSearch resources might look like.

comments.author: Grant Ingersoll
comments.content:
Looks pretty good.  I think it might make more sense to just integrate this into the example (via /browse?) and not into the main webapp (index.jsp)

At any rate, I think it makes sense to make it easy for Solr to work w/ OpenSearch.

comments.author: Alexandre Rafalovitch
comments.content:
OpenSearch has stalled as a global standard. But also - perhaps more importantly - Solr is not designed to be exposed directly to the web, so supporting OpenSearch is of limited use.

Close?

comments.author: David Smiley
comments.content: Agreed; and I have some experience implementing the server & client (Solr based of course). Closing.
